task.title: How to Create a Poloniex Account
task.shortdesc: How to create a Poloniex account to exchange Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), or Litecoin (LTC) from your Coinbase account for other digital currencies.

taskbody.prereq:
Completing the following instructions will require:
A personal computer with Internet access.
A smartphone with either a valid SIM card and active phone number, or with the Googe Voice app installed to provide you a valid phone number, with the Google Authenticator app also installed.
taskbody.context: After completing this task, you will have an account on Poloniex, a online market for digital currency exchange. You will have the option to can transfer Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), or Litecoin (LTC) from your Coinbase account to your Poloniex account, allowing you to trade one digital currency for another without using local currencies as transaction intermediaries.

step.cmd: Open your Internet browser.
Navigate to .
Select "Create an Account" at the center of the page.
Read Poloniex's Terms of Use.
Enter your name, country of resident, phone number, email address, and password into the felds shown below:
After filling in these fields, click "Create Account."

Once you've submitted the form, Poloniex will send you an email containing a link to verify your account. Go ahead and log into your email inbox, open the email from Poloniex, and click the link inside:
After clicking the link in Poloniex's confirmation email, you will have finished creating your Poloniex account.
Log in to your newly-created Poloniex account. Once logged in, you sould see a four icons on the right of the site header.
Select the wrench icon. From the icon's dropdown menu, select "My Profile":
In order to better guarantee the safety of your Poloniex account (and to increase your account's daily withdrawal limit), select and complete the "My Profile" from the dropdown menu shown above.

After completing your user profile, return once more to the website header, and select the wrench icon to the immediate left of the icon you selected in Step 9. From the dropdown menu, select "Two-Factor Authentication":
You will arrive at the Poloniex page for Two-Factor Authentication, shown below:

As you see on the right of this page, Poloniex has produced a 16-digit key that will allow you to access your Poloniex account if, for example, you lost your phone, or if for any other reason two-factor authentication becomes unavailable. Save this key in case of emergencies.
Fill in the forms on the left of Poloniex's Two-Factor Authentication site, using the email and password with which you registered your account. Move on to the next step to produce the required code.
Open the Google Authenticator app on your mobile device.
Select the icon of three vertical dots in the upper right corner, and select "Add Account."
Under "Add Account," select "Other account (Google, Facebook, etc.)."
Your phone will display the view of its front-facing camera, with lines representing the corners of a box laid over the camera's image.
Fit the QR code displayed on Poloniex's Two-Factor Authentication page within the lines imposed over the view of your front-facing camera.

With a few moments, Google Authenticator will automatically add Poloniex to its registry, and (beneath a secondary header entitled "Poloniex") display a six-digit code that renews itself every thirty seconds.
Input this six-digit code into Poloniex's Two-Factor Authentication form. If you have inputted the code before it renewed itself, you should see the following page as confrmation:

Congratulations! You have created and secured your Poloniex account. You may now transfer digital currencies from your Coinbase account (or from any other account holding digital currencies) to your Poloniex account, and begin trading these on the Poloniex market.
